section.title: Provision a server by attaching a port with an isolated network
section.para: To create your new server and attach a port, you need the following information:

listitem.para: The name of the new server. Use a name of your choice.

The image ID. For how to list images, see
List Images.

The flavor ID. For how to list flavors, see
List Flavors.
The port ID. This is the ID you copied in “Create a port”

section.para: You specify these values as parameters in a nova command or as attributes in the request body in a cURL command.

sidebar.para:
Next step: Choose one of the following methods:
“Provision a server with a port and network using the nova client”
“Provision a server with a port and network using cURL”

section.title: Provision a server with a port and network using the nova client

procedure.title: To provision a server and attach an isolated network

step.para:
Issue the following nova client command:
$ nova boot ServerAmp --image 82e72de5-6366-4217-8c87-a570a9b17e73 --nic port-id=c23c2fff-c07f-4af0-bc37-8ad883231f7c --flavor 1

section.title: Provision a server with a port and network using cURL

procedure.title: To provision a server with an isolated network to the server

step.para: Issue the following cURL command: $ curl https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2/$account/servers \ -X POST \ -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: $account" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -H "Accept: application/json" \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -d '{"server": {"name": "ServerAmp", "imageRef": "82e72de5-6366-4217-8c87-a570a9b17e73", "flavorRef": "1", "max_count": 1, "min_count": 1, "port": {"id": "c23c2fff-c07f-4af0-bc37-8ad883231f7c"}}}' \ | python -m json.tool
Output: The API operation returns information about the new server, as shown in the following output:

procedure.title: To provision a server and attach an isolated network to the server

step.para: Issue the following cURL command: $ curl -i https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2/$account/servers.xml \ -X POST \ -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: $account" \ -H "Content-Type: application/xml" \ -H "Accept: application/xml" \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -d '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><server xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" imageRef="82e72de5-6366-4217-8c87-a570a9b17e73" flavorRef="1" name="ServerAmp"><ports><id>c23c2fff-c07f-4af0-bc37-8ad883231f7c></server>'
